title: 署理行政長官出席第十五屆全國運動會火炬傳遞香港站收火儀式致辭（只有中文）（附圖）
news_content:
以下是署理行政長官陳國基今日（十一月二日）出席第十五屆全國運動會（十五運會）火炬傳遞香港站收火儀式的致辭：

各位嘉賓、各位朋友、各位市民：

大家好！我相信大家剛才均很開心，轉眼間，我們由添馬公園來到啟德體育園，共同見證第十五屆全國運動會 香港賽區火炬傳遞的收火儀式。

剛才，我們一同見證了火炬傳遞的精彩過程。50位來自不同界別的火炬手，一棒接一棒，將火炬從維多利亞港兩岸，傳遞到我們所在的啟德體育園。而這裏，將會是今屆全運會手球、擊劍和七人欖球三個精彩項目的決戰舞台。

火炬手沿途跑過的每一步，都伴隨着市民熱烈的歡呼和打氣。這份全城投入的熱情，不僅向世界展現香港的活力，亦呈現我們以「簡約、安全、精彩」的原則，順利完成火炬傳遞。

十五運會開幕禮將於十一月九日舉行，而部分競賽項目已經展開。當中，維多利亞公園的沙灘排球賽事熱力四射，啟德體育園體藝館的男子手球激戰也已經開始。

更令人振奮的是，我們的帆船運動員貝俊龍，早前已經為中國香港代表團奪得本屆全運會的第一面金牌。這是一個絕對令人振奮的開始，而憑藉着我們運動員的堅持與努力，以及不屈不撓的精神，我衷心祝願中國香港代表團於其他項目盡展所長，屢創佳績！

稍後，承載着我們共同祝願，名為「星火築夢」的火種燈，會從啟德體育園出發，前往廣州。屆時，廣州、深圳、香港和澳門的火種會進行融火儀式，其後新火種將會在十五運會開幕式場內燃點主火炬。

趁着這個充滿熱情與動力的時刻，我必須提提大家十二月七日就是立法會換屆選舉，大家一定要記得投票。

最後，我衷心感謝所有為火炬傳遞付出努力的人員，其實大家都不容易，有很多人陪伴（火炬手）一棒接一棒地跑，是辛苦的。我祝願第十五屆全國運動會取得圓滿成功！

多謝大家！

title: 65th round of computer ballot registration for submitting applications for Northbound Travel for Hong Kong Vehicles to be open November 3 to 6
news_content:
The Transport Department today (November 2) reminded members of the public that the 65th round of computer ballot registration for submitting applications for Northbound Travel for Hong Kong Vehicles (the scheme) will be open from 10am tomorrow (November 3) to 11.59pm on November 6, and the ballot result will be announced on November 7.

Eligible applicants for the scheme can register for computer balloting through the designated website (www.hzmbqfs.gov.hk). Successful balloting applicants are required to submit applications for the scheme within the designated application period.

title: HK's smart development recognised
news_content:
Hong Kong ranks eighth among 73 cities in the Hong Kong Polytechnic University (PolyU)'s 2025 Smart City Index, with digital initiatives of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Governmentsuch as the "iAM Smart" platform being recognised as vital to the city's smart transformation for enhancing everyday convenience for citizens and boosting administrative efficiency.

  News.gov.hk interviewed a representative from the Digital Policy Office about the new features of "iAM Smart" and the platform's key role in promoting the city's smart development. In addition, a researcher from the PolyU explained the reasons for Hong Kong's high ranking. 

  The story is available at www.news.gov.hk/eng/feature from today (November 2) in text and video format.

title: 智慧城市　便民善治
news_content:
香港理工大學（理大）公布的二○二五年「智慧城市指數」顯示，香港在全球73個城市中排名第八。研究團隊指，香港特別行政區政府大力推動智慧城市和智慧政府發展，其中「智方便」數字服務平台為市民帶來生活便利，也提升政府效率。

數字政策辦公室代表接受《政府新聞網》訪問，講述「智方便」的最新功能，以及該平台在政府推動智慧城市發展的關鍵作用。而理大團隊則剖析香港能夠在智慧城市指數高踞前列的原因。

有關報道今日（十一月二日）以文字和短片方式上載至www.news.gov.hk/chi/feature。

title: 署理行政長官出席第十五屆全國運動會火炬傳遞香港站起跑儀式致辭（只有中文）
news_content:
以下是署理行政長官陳國基今日（十一月二日）出席第十五屆全國運動會火炬傳遞香港站起跑儀式的致辭：

各位嘉賓、各位朋友、各位市民：

大家早晨！今日，我很高興與大家見證這個屬於粵港澳大灣區的歷史時刻——第十五屆全國運動會香港賽區火炬傳遞起跑！

今次火炬傳遞在廣東、香港和澳門三地同日啓動，不單是一項創舉，更充分展現出粵港澳大灣區的獨特優勢。粵港澳三地同心協力，融合發展，匯聚更強能量，共同建設國際一流灣區和世界級城市群。香港火炬傳遞的路線，就好像一次城市的巡遊，50位火炬手將會穿梭於我們引以為傲的城市地標，以及現代化的體育設施。由享譽世界的維多利亞港，到象徵蓬勃體育發展的啟德體育園。火炬所到之處，都會向全世界展示香港作為國際都會和盛事之都的非凡魅力。

第十五屆全運會是匯聚全國頂尖運動精英的體育盛事。香港很榮幸獲得國家信任，承辦其中八個項目，讓市民留在香港，都可以親身欣賞國家頂尖運動員的精湛技術，感受國家頂級賽事的緊張氣氛。

我誠意呼籲大家踴躍購票入場，用熱烈的掌聲與歡呼聲，為所有拼搏的運動健兒加油打氣。你們的現場支持，是對運動員最大的鼓勵，亦是本屆全運會圓滿成功的重要後盾。

各位市民，你們的熱情參與，更可以讓我們用行動證明，香港不僅具備高效承辦賽事的能力，更擁有一群熱愛體育、充滿熱情的運動支持者。

火炬手即將出發，讓我們藉着火炬傳遞，全城同心，將我們對十五運會最誠摯的祝福與期盼，傳遍香港每一個角落，並攜手迎接這場國家體育盛事，共同寫下十五運會的精彩篇章！

多謝大家！

title: Update on chikungunya fever
news_content:
The Centre for Health Protection (CHP) of the Department of Health announced that as of 5pm today (November 1), the CHP has recorded two new cases of chikungunya fever (CF), which are imported cases.

Latest cases information
---------------------------

ãã The first case involves a 32-year-old female living in Sha Tin District. A preliminary investigation revealed that she visited India alone between October 9 and 23. She developed a rash and joint pain on October 23 and a fever on October 24. She sought medical attention at a private doctor on October 29. She then attended the Accident and Emergency Department of the Prince of Wales Hospital on the same day and was admitted for treatment in a mosquito-free environment. She is in stable condition now. Her blood sample tested positive for chikungunya virus upon laboratory testing.Since the patient stayed in India during her incubation period, the CHP considered that she was infected during travel. The case was classified as imported. The CHP's epidemiological investigation is ongoing, and it will report the case to the health authority of India.

The second case involves a 32-year-old male living in the Central and Western District. He travelled to Macao and Zhuhai in Guangdong Province with three family members on October 4 and 5. He developed a fever on October 28, and skin rash and joint pain in his hands and feet on October 29. He sought medical attention at the outpatient clinic of a private hospital on October 30. He was arranged to be admitted to Queen Mary Hospital for treatment in a mosquito-free environment yesterday (October 31). He is in stable condition now. His blood sample tested positive for chikungunya virus upon laboratory testing.

As the patient has visited CF-affected areas for travel about three weeks before the onset, although the incubation period for CF is normally within two weeks, some infected patients may have very mild initial symptoms, which might be unnoticed. Besides, the CHP's epidemiological investigation revealed that the patient has not been to the vicinity of Fung Tak Estate in Wong Tai Sin. Therefore, the CHP cannot rule out the possibility that the case may be infected during travel. The CHP will report the case to the health authority of Guangdong Province. However, for the sake of prudence, the CHP has immediately contacted the Food and Environmental Hygiene Department (FEHD) to enhance mosquito prevention and control measures to the places where the patient visited during the incubation period. The CHP will also arrange blood tests for his three travel collaterals. Epidemiological investigation is ongoing.

Latest surveillance data
-------------------------------

 So far this year, Hong Kong has recorded a total of 54 confirmed CF cases, including two local cases and 52 imported cases.

As of 5pm today, the CHP has conducted assessments for about 10 200 residents through the health consultation booth on the second floor of Fung Tak Shopping Centre, its inquiry hotline and door-to-door visits in Fung Tak Estate. Among them, 38 individuals with mild symptoms have been arranged to undergo blood tests. Laboratory testing is continuing. As of 5pm today, 36 samples have completed testing and are all negative for the chikungunya virus.

  Since the beginning of 2025, and as of September 30, a total of 445 271 suspected and confirmed CF cases and 155 CF-related deaths have been reported in 40 countries/territories. Cases have been reported in the Americas, Africa, Asia, and Europe. CF outbreaks currently occur in many countries worldwide. Members of the public should check the situation of the destinations before travelling abroad.

Government's continuous comprehensive actions on prevention and control of CF
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The CHP continued to implement various prevention and control measures together with various Government departments and relevant organisations, striving to prevent CF from taking root locally and minimise the public health impact of the disease in Hong Kong.

The CHP officers and District Services & Community Care Teams will continue to contact the residents in the district, disseminate information, and understand and follow up on their health conditions. The CHP has also issued letters to doctors, hospitals, schools and institutions, providing the latest information on CF and reminding them to be vigilant.

In addition, the CHP has set up an inquiry hotline (2125 2373) and the abovementioned health consultation booth. The hotline and health consultation booth will continue to operate from 9am to 8pm daily to provide assessments to residents with relevant symptoms and answer enquiries relating to CF.

The FEHD and relevant departments have comprehensively enhanced the mosquito control operations in Hong Kong since July this year, and this has continued. Among these, the FEHD has conducted vector investigations and targeted mosquito control operations against the imported cases. In light of the local case, the FEHD has immediately conducted follow-up actions, including:


carrying out intensive fogging in scrubby areas within a 250-metre radius of the relevant locations to kill adult mosquitoes;
carrying out inspections of the locations, removing stagnant water, applying insecticides and disposing of abandoned water containers every week with a view to preventing mosquito breeding; and
enhancing public education efforts through organising health talks, setting up mobile education stations, and distributing publicity leaflets.

ãã
 The abovementioned measures will be continued. Furthermore, the Government will further enhance the mosquito control efforts in addition to the existing measures.

Preventive measures taken by the public
----------------------------------------------

Severe symptoms and deaths caused by CF are extremely rare, with a mortality rate of less than one in 1 000. The occurrence of severe complications is mostly related to the patients' underlying health conditions. Elderly persons (particularly those aged 65 or above), young children (particularly infants under 1 year old), pregnant women and persons with chronic illnesses (such as hypertension, diabetes or heart disease) are at higher risk of developing complications after contracting CF and may require a longer recovery period. Therefore, members of the public (especially the abovementioned high-risk groups) are advised to seek medical advice promptly if they develop relevant symptoms, particularly a fever, sudden severe joint pain and skin rash, after visiting areas affected by CF.

Members of the public should use DEET-containing insect repellents or other effective active ingredients properly to prevent mosquito bites, but the following precautions should be taken when using them:


read the label instructions carefully first;
apply right before entering an area with a risk of mosquito bites;
apply on exposed skin and clothing;
use DEET of up to 30 per cent for pregnant women and up to 10 per cent for children (For children who travel to countries or areas where mosquito-borne diseases are endemic or epidemic and where exposure is likely, those aged 2 months or above can use DEET-containing insect repellents with a DEET concentration of up to 30 per cent);
apply sunscreen first, then insect repellent;
reapply only when needed and follow the instructions; and
in addition to DEET, there are other insect repellents available on the market containing different active ingredients, such as IR3535 and picaridin. When using any insect repellent, the public should follow the usage instructions and precautions on the product label.


  The FEHD also appeals to members of the public to continue to stay alert and work together to carry out mosquito prevention and control measures early, including inspecting their homes and surroundings to remove potential breeding grounds, changing water in vases and scrubbing their inner surfaces, removing water in saucers under potted plants at least once a week, and properly disposing of containers such as empty cans and lunch boxes. The FEHD also advises members of the public and property management agencies to keep drains free of blockage and level all defective ground surfaces to prevent the accumulation of water. They should also scrub all drains and surface sewers with an alkaline detergent at least once a week to remove any mosquito eggs.
ã
The public should call 1823 in case of mosquito problems, and may visit the following pages for more information: the CF page of theCHPand theTravel Health Service, the latestTravel Health News,tips for using insect repellents, and the CHPFacebook Page,Instagram AccountandYouTube Channel, and also theMosquito Prevention and Control dedicated pageof the FEHD.

最新個案資料
——————

首宗個案涉及一名32歲女子，住所位於沙田區。初步調查顯示，她於十月九日至二十三日獨自到訪印度。她於十月二十三日出現皮疹及關節痛，十月二十四日出現發燒。她於十月二十九日向私家醫生求醫，同日向威爾斯親王醫院急症室求醫及入院，在無蚊環境下接受治療，目前情況穩定。她的血液樣本對基孔肯雅病毒呈陽性反應。由於病人於潛伏期曾到訪印度，中心認為她是在外遊期間受到感染，屬輸入個案。中心會繼續進行流行病學調查，並會把個案通報印度衞生當局。

第二宗個案涉及一名32歲男子，住所位於中西區，他於十月四日至五日與三名家人一同前往澳門及廣東省珠海市旅遊。他於十月二十八日出現發燒，十月二十九日出現皮膚紅疹及手腳關節顯著疼痛。他於十月三十日前往一間私家醫院的門診求診，昨日（十月三十一日）被安排入住瑪麗醫院，在無蚊環境下接受治療，目前情況穩定。他的血液樣本對基孔肯雅病毒呈陽性反應。

由於個案在病發前約三星期曾前往受基孔肯雅熱影響的地方旅遊，儘管基孔肯雅熱的潛伏期一般都在兩周以內，但部分感染人士初期病徵可能十分輕微而沒被察覺。此外，中心的流行病學調查顯示，病人返港後沒有到過黃大仙鳳德邨一帶活動。因此中心不排除個案可能在外遊期間受到感染，中心會把個案通報廣東省衞生當局。然而，為審慎起見，中心已即時聯絡食物環境衞生署（食環署），加強對病人在潛伏期內到過的地點進行滅蚊及控蚊工作；中心亦會安排他的三名同行人士接受血液檢測。流行病學調查仍在進行中。

最新監測數據
——————

本港今年累計錄得54宗基孔肯雅熱確診個案。兩宗屬本地個案，52宗屬輸入個案。

截至今日下午五時，中心透過設於鳳德商場二樓的醫護站、熱線電話及於鳳德邨進行上門探訪，已為約10 200名居民作評估，並已安排38名出現輕微病徵的市民接受抽血檢查，化驗工作正陸續進行。截至今日下午五時，中心已完成檢驗36名市民的血液樣本，全部對基孔肯雅病毒呈陰性。

自二○二五年初至九月三十日，全球40個國家／地區呈報了445 271宗基孔肯雅熱病例及155宗相關死亡個案。個案分布在美洲、非洲、亞洲及歐洲。現時全球多國正爆發基孔肯雅熱，市民外遊前必須注意當地情況。

政府繼續全方位防控基孔肯雅熱
——————————————

中心正繼續聯同政府多個部門和相關機構採取適當防控措施，全力預防基孔肯雅熱在本地扎根和減低疾病對本港公共衞生的影響。

中心人員和當區關愛隊會繼續聯絡區內居民發放資訊，了解及跟進他們的健康情況。中心亦已發信給醫生、醫院、學校及院舍，講解基孔肯雅熱的最新情況，並提醒他們提高警覺。

另外，中心由十月二十六日起設立熱線（電話：2125 2373）及上述的醫護站，每日由上午九時至下午八時運作，為出現相關症狀的居民作評估和解答市民有關基孔肯雅熱的查詢。

食環署聯同相關部門自今年七月起已在全港各區全面加強控蚊工作，至今一直持續。其中，食環署已對早前所有輸入個案進行病媒調查及針對性滅蚊工作。因應出現本地個案，食環署已立即採取跟進行動，包括：

• 在相關地點附近250米範圍內樹木茂密的地點進行密集式霧化處理工作，以殺滅成蚊；
• 巡查上述地點，清理積水，施放殺蟲劑及清除遺棄的水載容器，以防止蚊子滋生；及
• 加強宣傳教育，包括舉辦健康講座、設置流動教育中心及派發宣傳單張等。

上述措施會持續進行。此外，政府會在現有強化措施的基礎上，進一步加強全港控蚊工作。

市民應採取的防預措施
——————————

由基孔肯雅熱所引致的嚴重症狀及死亡十分罕見，死亡率少於千分之一，出現嚴重併發症大多與病人的自身健康情況有關。長者（特別是65歲以上）、幼童（特別是一歲以下的嬰兒）、懷孕婦女及長期病患者（例如患有高血壓、糖尿病、心臟病等人士）感染基孔肯雅熱後，較大機會引起併發症，康復時間亦較長。因此，中心建議市民（特別是上述的高危組別）如到訪受基孔肯雅熱影響的地區後出現相關病徵，尤其是發燒、關節突然劇痛及出現皮疹，應盡快求醫。

市民應使用含避蚊胺或其他有效活性成分的昆蟲驅避劑可有效防蚊，但使用時應注意以下事項：

• 先仔細閱讀標籤說明；
• 在進入可能被蚊叮的範圍前使用；
• 塗在外露皮膚及衣服；
• 孕婦使用避蚊胺的濃度上限是30%，兒童則為10%（如前往蚊傳疾病流行的國家或地區而有機會被蚊叮咬，兩個月或以上的兒童可使用濃度上限為30%的避蚊胺）；
• 先塗防曬霜，再塗昆蟲驅避劑；
• 遵照標籤說明，只於有需要時重複使用；及
• 除了避蚊胺之外，市面上亦有含其他活性成分的昆蟲驅避劑，例如IR3535、埃卡瑞丁（亦稱派卡瑞丁）等。公眾使用任何昆蟲驅避劑時，應遵從產品標籤上的使用說明及注意事項。

食環署亦呼籲市民繼續提高警覺及攜手合作，及早於家居及其他環境採取防蚊及滅蚊措施，包括視察家居及附近環境、徹底清除可供蚊子滋生的地方、每周最少一次徹底更換花瓶的水及擦洗內壁並清倒盆栽墊碟的水、妥善棄置空罐和飯盒等容器。此外，食環署亦建議市民和物業管理公司，應保持溝渠暢通及填平凹陷的地面，以防積水，並每周最少一次以鹼性清潔劑擦洗溝渠和排水明渠，除去可能積聚的蚊卵。

市民如發現蚊患，應致電1823，亦可參閱以下專題網頁，了解詳情：衞生防護中心及旅遊健康服務基孔肯雅熱專頁、最新旅遊情報、使用昆蟲驅避劑的注意事項、中心Facebook專頁、Instagram帳戶及YouTube頻道，以及食環署防控蚊患專頁。

title: Missing woman in Tsing Yi located
news_content:
A woman who went missing in Tsing Yi has been located.

Kam Lai-fan, aged 67, went missing after she was last seen at the Tsing Yi Promenade yesterday (October 31) morning. Her family then made a report to Police.

The woman was located outside on San Wan Road, Sheung Shui this afternoon (November 1). She sustained no injuries and no suspicious circumstances were detected.

title: Remarks by CE at media session in Korea (with photo/video)
news_content:
The Chief Executive, Mr John Lee, met the media in Gyeongju, Korea, this afternoon (November 1) after attending the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Economic Leaders' Meeting and other related activities. Following are Mr Lee's remarks:

Reporter: Good afternoon, Mr Lee. How were your encounters with President Xi Jinping during the APEC summit? Was there any important message on Hong Kong? With Shenzhen being the host city for next year's APEC summit, any plans and expectations as to how Hong Kong can co-operate or facilitate with the summit? During this time, how would you capitalise on the outcomes that you have made during your time in Gyeongju? Thank you.

Chief Executive: President Xi cares very much about Hong Kong. And I was very glad that I could make use of this opportunity to report to him the latest social and economic developments of Hong Kong. We also very slightly touched on the political situation that we're facing. I feel all along the sincere care of President Xi for Hong Kong and his staunch support for Hong Kong. I am very grateful for that. He is a very affectionate leader. Each and every time he will be encouraging me to continue to do my job well, so I sincerely thank President Xi for that.

I'm of course very motivated to know that APEC 2026 will be held in our country - in Shenzhen. We're thrilled, particularly when Shenzhen is our very neighbouring city. Our relationship is very close. The Hong Kong SAR (Special Administrative Region) Government will do all our best to support and co-operate with all the possible arrangements that will be of help to the overall launching of the meeting. I believe that of course the Central Government will take into consideration the whole arrangement of different setups of the APEC conference, and also will make reference to the guidelines that is laid down by APEC in respect of the arrangement for the meeting. The Hong Kong Government is fully prepared and will be very excited to be able to take any part to support the arrangement and the successful conduct of the APEC conference.

You asked about the achievements of my attendance at this APEC conference. We have made achievements in several areas. Through the participation in the APEC meeting, we contributed to the promotion of free trade and economic integration. First of all, the APEC economies jointly adopted and issued the Leaders' Declaration, which is very important, because its emphasis on economic co-operation, connectivity and also the building of resilient supply chains. The Declaration addresses the importance of shared opportunities and challenges facing us, and important goal of "Connect", "Innovate" and "Prosper".

The second achievement is that, through the participation in these APEC meetings and activities, we further strengthened our ties with the host country – Korea. Different Secretaries of the Hong Kong SAR Government have attended APEC meetings in the two weeks prior to the actual summit, including the Financial Secretary, the Secretary for Justice, and also the Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development. Korea is the fifth-largest trading partner of Hong Kong. And the trade has been increasing in the rate of 20 per cent year-on-year. On tourism, we welcomed , in 2024, 850 000 visitors from Korea. This is double the figure of the previous year. With the Kai Tak Sports Park opened, we have been welcoming a lot of K-pop performances, and we look forward to welcoming more Korean visitors as we have more exceptional performances. We signed an MOU (Memorandum of Understanding) with the Busan Asian Film School in September to allow Hong Kong filmmakers to participate in an eight-month training course in Busan. Also, the number of flights between Hong Kong and Busan has increased by about 70 per cent year-on-year in October this year, pursuing the increase in the number of exchanges both ways. We also opened up a new flight route to Daegu in June this year.

The third achievement is that we have strengthened relations and exchanges with various ASEAN (Association of Southeast Asian Nations) countries. I had a bilateral meeting with the Prime Minister of Singapore, Mr Lawrence Wong. We touched on a wide range of issues that the immediate results of the discussions is that there will be a Hong Kong delegation comprising Permanent Secretaries to visit Singapore. This will be the second visit after the last visit in 2023 by Permanent Secretaries from the Singaporean Government. Also, I discussed with the President of Indonesia, and we agreed to explore the possibility of Indonesian cultural and arts delegations visiting Hong Kong to perform. In regards to the Hong Kong Economic and Trade Office (ETO) which we want to set up in Malaysia, I'm glad to be informed that, in the discussion with the Prime Minister of Malaysia, both of us are very keen and optimistic that the ETO will be in operation before the end of this year in Kuala Lumpur.

The fourth achievement is that we have deepened exchanges and co-operation with the Middle East. I met with the Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, and we talked about various issues. He indicated that Hong Kong is a very attractive place for investments, certainly one of the focus areas. And one important thing is Hong Kong is a bridge to Mainland cities, so he has indicated that he will be paying a lot of attention to the Hong Kong market. We welcomed that very much.

The fifth achievement is that we have strengthened exchanges with the international organisation of IMF (International Monetary Fund). I met with the Managing Director, and I first of all talked about Hong Kong's strengths as an international financial centre. In fact, the IMF did an article for consultation a year before, and confirmed Hong Kong's position as the one of the world's three major international financial centres and recognising the resilience and strengths that are in our regime.

We will capitalise on the visit on this occasion, so that we will continue to strengthen ties with different economies and also follow up some of the issues that we brought up in the discussion.

(Please also refer to the Chinese portion of the remarks.)

title: ​行政長官在韓國會見傳媒談話內容（附圖／短片）
news_content:
以下是行政長官李家超出席亞太區經濟合作組織領導人非正式會議及相關活動後，今日（十一月一日）下午在韓國慶州會見傳媒的談話內容：

行政長官：大家好。首先多謝大家連日來採訪我在韓國慶州出席亞太區經濟合作組織（APEC）會議。

昨日，我出席了APEC領導人與東道主嘉賓非正式對話、APEC商貿諮詢理事會成員對話，以及主辦方所設的歡迎晚宴。我在不同場合與多個經濟體領袖交流，增進關係。我分別與新加坡總理、阿聯酋（阿拉伯聯合酋長國）阿布扎比王儲進行雙邊會談，以及與國際貨幣基金組織總裁會面，交流意見。今日，我出席了APEC領導人非正式會議。

較早前，我分別與在韓國的港人和港企代表會面，了解他們在當地的生活和發展情況，又與APEC商貿諮詢理事會中國香港代表聚會交流，聽取他們就推廣香港優勢、加強區域合作等議題的意見。

我想總結一下，今次來到韓國出席APEC會議的成果。

第一，通過參與APEC會議，推動自由貿易及經濟融合。香港是一個自由開放的國際城市，自由貿易、多邊貿易是香港賴以成功的基石，鞏固香港經濟發展。我在會議上發言時提出，要秉持包容、平等與合作的原則，堅持多邊主義；發揮AI的創新力量，將AI作為經濟增長的關鍵驅動力；呼籲成員經濟體用好APEC平台拓展合作，釋放嶄新而且包容的增長力量。

APEC 21個成員經濟體共同通過和發表《2025年APEC領導人慶州宣言》 支持APEC作為區域經濟合作的重要平台、加強亞太區的互聯互通，以及構建具韌性的供應鏈。宣言涵蓋亞太地區共同面對的機遇與挑戰，實現亞太區經濟體「連接、創新、繁榮」，期待在這些領域與各成員經濟體開展實務工作，推動亞太區高質量經濟發展。

第二，透過APEC會議和活動，鞏固了與東道主韓國的經貿和人文往來。特區政府先後派出多名官員來到韓國出席APEC會議和活動，包括財政司司長、律政司司長一個多星期前到仁川，分別出席財政部長會議、結構改革部長會議；商經局局長今個星期亦來到慶州，出席部長級會議。

韓國是香港第五大貿易夥伴。兩地的商品貿易總額在過去五年，平均每年上升4.4%。在二○二四年達港幣3,559億元，較二○二三年上升接近兩成。目前約有160家韓國公司在香港營運，其中約四成選擇香港作為地區總部或地區辦事處。近年，兩地的行業及商務代表團的互訪活動頻繁。

在旅客方面，去年，香港接待了約85萬人次韓國旅客，年增長一倍以上。啟德體育園今年啓用後，已吸引知名的K-Pop團體舉行演唱會。未來數月，會有不同K-Pop隊伍的演唱會以及相關頒獎禮在香港舉辦，我們期待迎接更多來自韓國的朋友。

上星期，特區政府在首爾舉行的「香港周2025@首爾」圓滿結束，這項大型文化交流盛事，展示了14項代表了香港精髓的文化藝術節目。

在電影交流方面，特區政府在九月與釜山亞洲電影學院簽署諒解備忘錄，讓香港電影人到釜山參加為期八個月的培訓課程。

另外，隨着兩地人民交往不斷增加，香港前往釜山的航班數目於今年十月按年增長約七成，另外在今年六月開通了前往大邱市的新航班。

第三，加強與不同東盟（東南亞國家聯盟）成員國的關係和交流合作。今次在慶州，我在不同場合和不同的東盟領袖和官員見面交流。

我昨日與新加坡總理黃循財先生進行雙邊會議，涵蓋政府交流合作、企業投資、產業發展、民間往來，以及金融和科技發展的未來路向等。

雙方同意積極推動兩地公務員互訪交流，分享經驗。香港政府的常任秘書長將組團訪問新加坡，這會是繼二○二三年新加坡常秘團訪港後，再一次高層公務員互訪交流。

另外，我和印尼總統普拉博沃．蘇比安托先生交流時，雙方同意研究印尼文化藝術代表團訪港演出的可能性。

我亦和馬來西亞總理安華先生討論有關香港設立駐馬來西亞經貿辦（經濟貿易辦事處）的進度，雙方都同意進展良好，有信心在今年底，香港經貿辦將在吉隆坡投入運作。這會是香港在東盟成員國設立的第四個經貿辦。

第四，繼續深化和中東的交往合作。我昨日與阿布扎比王儲哈立德先生會面。這是繼我在二○二三年首次率團訪問阿聯酋之後，再一次與阿聯酋領袖作深入交流。香港與阿聯酋的商品貿易總額在過去五年，平均每年上升14.3%，在二○二四年達港幣1,256億元。

王儲表示，香港是阿聯酋重視的投資市場，香港的金融體系高效穩健、法律健全，香港貿易蓬勃，本身已是很大投資機遇，更是進入內地的橋樑。雙方同意進一步推進多個領域的合作，包括貿易、投資、金融、科技及旅遊等。

第五，鞏固和國際組織的交流。我在會議期間與國際貨幣基金組織（IMF）總裁格奧爾基耶娃女士會面。IMF在上年調研後，肯定香港的國際金融中心地位，認同香港的金融體系制度框架健全、政策緩衝空間充足、聯繫匯率制度暢順運作。我在會議上表示，香港作為全球三大金融中心之一，會進一步推動金融發展，包括配置資產的機遇，優化資本市場、便利企業籌融資、提升市場流動性和穩慎推動金融創新發展，促進金融服務業可持續發展。

另外，中國將擔任APEC 二○二六年東道主，主辦城市是深圳。香港會全力支持及配合國家籌辦APEC 2026的工作。我們熱切期待明年在自己國家參與會議，與各經濟體成員一同深化亞太合作。

我在韓國的行程接近尾聲。我會在明日啓程返香港。

記者：特首，你好。剛才提到會全力配合深圳APEC明年舉行，香港作為國際金融中心，會否可能有機會協助舉辦部分會議，譬如是財政部長會議？另外一個問題是關於拓展香港的經貿網絡方面，剛才提到吉隆坡辦事處會在年底開始運作，會否有比較具體的開幕日子，大概是哪一段時間？以及，香港目前在東亞只有東京經貿辦，南韓還未有，今次到來南韓之後，會否在日後都考慮在南韓首爾或者其他地方設立經貿辦？多謝。

行政長官：非常高興我們國家在明年舉辦APEC 2026，深圳會是主辦城市。我剛才說得很清楚，我們會全力支持和配合國家舉辦今次APEC 2026。

我相信國家會考慮整個會議的布局，以及參考APEC會議有關這方面的指引，從而作出整體的部署。我們會全力地配合和支持國家在這方面的任何要求，我相信大家都會很鼓舞，因為香港和深圳是兄弟城市，我們很接近，有任何可以支持配合的，香港特區政府會全力以赴。

第二是有關我們的經貿辦。我們很有信心在吉隆坡的經貿辦在今年年底之前會開始正式運作。我和馬來西亞總理都希望可以盡早，但大家都有自己的日程安排，所以雙方的辦事處同事都會溝通交流。但我和安華總理都有信心，一定會在年底前正式運作，這方面我們會努力，我們的準備工作已經做好，包括同事和其他配置。

另外，在設立經貿辦方面，當然我們會考慮整體對香港的經貿發展。韓國我們是重視的，但設立經貿辦涉及很多法律方面的問題需要解決，包括一些特權和豁免，這方面我們會繼續商討，大家雙方正在努力中。

記者：特首，你覺得今次整體APEC的成果是怎樣？除新加坡外，還有否和其他RCEP（《區域全面經濟伙伴關係協定》）成員國討論爭取香港獲得其支持來加入RCEP？今次如之前APEC會議一樣，你與國家主席習近平一起出席會議，並有交談，談論了甚麼內容？有否提及未來的十二月立法會選舉，向他談及最新的選舉情況如何？有否談到會支持你繼續帶領香港，甚至競選下一屆特首？

行政長官：在我與習主席交談期間，習主席很關心香港，我也利用當時時間向他匯報了香港最新的社會和經濟發展情況。

習主席亦和我很扼要地討論過，現時我們所面對的地緣政治問題。他聽我的匯報時，當然是很關心、很重視，我很感受到他是一位很親切的領導，亦支持特區政府繼續做好自己的工作。

特區政府每一個時期都有很重要的事情要辦，所以特區政府一定要做好自己的事。在如此短暫的時間，當然我們討論的事情有限，就是我匯報了剛才所說的事項 。

我和不同的APEC經濟體領導溝通交談時，感受到他們對於中國的重視和尊重，特別是在整個過程中，對習主席的重視和所講的任何重要講話都是非常專注地聆聽。在整個過程中，我看到國家在國際事務上的影響力，有舉足輕重的份量，都是發揮好關鍵作用。

另外一點我感受很深的是，各個出席與會的領導人代表非常尊重習主席，特別是其個人領導魅力，我對此感受是很深的。

香港會辦好每一件事，所以今次我們出席APEC會議後，同事會總結在不同會議裏所談及的內容，或與不同領袖討論一些跟進事項，把每一件事情都落實好。

另外，我想回答剛才有記者提及關於RCEP的問題。RCEP是我非常重視的，因為是現在全世界最大的一個自由貿易協議。而RCEP 的15個成員國和香港的貿易關係非常龐大，所以對於香港是非常有利益，我們亦相信加入RCEP是可以作出貢獻，因為RCEP相信自由貿易和區域合作，而香港是一個崇尚自由貿易的開放城市，亦是一個低稅率、簡單稅制的地方，有很多優勢，包括在很多方面都沒有管制，包括資金管制、出入境管制、數量管制等。所以認為我們對於RCEP是很有貢獻。

大致上，我們所接觸的成員國都是支持的，當然有一些國家希望在我們正式進入的工作組時會討論細節。

我們亦知道有關進入RCEP的程序，已經在今年獲得同意，亦會成立一些將會進入的工作小組，我希望RCEP可以盡快成立為香港而設的工作組，我們已經準備就緒，隨時可以討論。我們亦會將香港的優勢和貢獻，向所有工作組的成員代表充分解說。我們有信心在這方面將香港的貢獻和優勢，令RCEP的成員認為其進入令大家都有幫助。

記者：會見習主席時你有沒有提到立法會選舉的最新情況？

行政長官：我們的時間和所傾談的事項的確有限，我剛才都說過，香港會辦好自己的事。在今次APEC會議中，不同經濟體的領導人所講的事情都是涉及宏觀國際合作的重要事情，但我充分感受到習主席對香港的關心和支持，亦感受到他領導的魅力和風範，對於香港的一直關心和支持，我亦表示感謝。多謝大家。

title: 消防處舉行冬季防災應急宣傳月啓動儀式暨「消防處社區應急先鋒」嘉許典禮（附圖）
news_content:
消防處今日（十一月一日）於沙田新城市廣場舉行冬季防災應急宣傳月啓動儀式暨「消防處社區應急先鋒」嘉許典禮，正式展開一系列冬季防災應急宣傳活動，並嘉許積極在社區推動「消防處社區應急先鋒」計劃的機構。

今年宣傳月以「封門待救」、「頭套防煙」及「偵測預警」三大應急技巧為主題，旨在教育市民如在遇上火警而需留在家中等待救援時，如何以膠紙封好門邊，並使用防煙頭套過濾濃煙及有害氣體，爭取黃金待救時間；又鼓勵市民在家中安裝獨立火警偵測器，以便在火警初期獲得警報並迅速逃生。消防處在活動上示範封門邊的正確方法，並透過防煙頭套和獨立火警偵測器展示、互動展區及攤位遊戲等活動，提升市民對防災應急的意識。

消防處副處長（公眾安全及機構策略）黃嘉榮在啓動禮上致辭時，感謝十八區地區防火委員會積極在社區凝聚力量，推動防災應急教育，在「消防處社區聯動網絡」協作下，全港十八區在一系列公眾安全策略關鍵績效指標已經全面達標，成績令人鼓舞。這些關鍵績效指標包括在區內到有潛在風險及火警隱患的大廈向市民宣傳防火資訊，協助居民安裝獨立火警偵測器，以及派發「防火三寶」。

黃嘉榮表示，消防處積極推廣的「消防處社區應急先鋒」計劃已培養超過6 500名不同年齡層和界別的市民，教授他們掌握滅火、自救和基本急救技巧。他感謝社區不同團體及機構協助推廣該計劃，安排員工接受培訓。活動上亦舉行「消防處社區應急先鋒」嘉許典禮，向17間積極參與相關計劃的機構頒發嘉許狀，表揚他們在推動公私營機構防災文化的貢獻。

黃嘉榮又指，投票是每一位選民都應該履行的公民責任，並呼籲市民必須珍惜手中選票，在十二月七日舉行的立法會換屆選舉中踴躍投票，選賢與能，為香港共同家園的更好未來投下神聖的一票。

在宣傳月期間，消防處將聯同各區民政事務處、地區防火委員會及社區夥伴，舉辦一系列地區防災應急活動，包括嘉年華、消防局開放日及商場重點宣傳活動。消防處又會派出流動宣傳車走訪社區，向市民宣揚防災應急信息。市民可透過消防處社交平台及「香港消防處」流動應用程式，獲取宣傳月的最新活動資訊。

冬季防災應急宣傳月為「香港消防處災難防控計劃」下的重點項目之一，由香港賽馬會慈善信託基金捐助，旨在全面提升社區的抗災能力。「消防處社區應急先鋒」計劃亦由香港賽馬會慈善信託基金捐助。

title: FSD holds Winter Disaster and Emergency Preparedness Promotional Months launching ceremony and FSDCER award ceremony (with photos)
news_content:
The Fire Services Department (FSD) held the Winter Disaster and Emergency Preparedness Promotional Months launching ceremony and Fire Services Department Community Emergency Responder (FSDCER) award ceremony at New Town Plaza in Sha Tin today (November 1). The event officially commenced a series of winter disaster preparedness promotional activities, while a number of organisations actively promoting the FSDCER scheme in the community were commended.

This year, three techniques on emergency preparedness, namely "seal the door and wait for rescue", "put on fire escape hoods for protection", and "detection and early warning", are featured areas of the Promotional Months. Members of the public are encouraged to learn skills of sealing door gaps with adhesive tapes and wearing fire escape hoods to filter smoke and hazardous gases, so as to stay safe when waiting for rescue at home in cases of infeasible fire evacuation. They can also install stand-alone fire detectors to receive early alert and make a timely escape when a fire breaks out. At the event, the FSD targeted to enhance public awareness of disaster and emergency preparedness through door-sealing demonstrations, fire escape hood and stand-alone fire detector displays, interactive exhibition areas, booth games, and more.

Speaking at the ceremony, the Deputy Director of Fire Services (Public Safety and Corporate Strategy), Mr Wong Ka-wing, expressed his gratitude to the 18 District Fire Safety Committees for strengthening community efforts in promoting disaster and emergency preparedness education. Under the co-ordination of the Fire Services Department Community Collaboration Network, all districts have successfully met the target set in key performance indicators (KPIs) for public safety strategy and made a remarkable achievement. The KPIs concerned include efforts in promoting fire safety information to residents of buildings with potential risks of fire hazards, assisting residents to install stand-alone fire detectors, and distributing "The Three Treasures for Fire Protection".

Mr Wong said that over 6 500 citizens from various age groups and sectors have received training under the FSDCER scheme to grasp basic skills on firefighting, self-rescue and first aid. He thanked community groups and organisations for arranging their staff members to receive training, in support of the scheme. At the event, 17 organisations were presented with certificates at the FSDCER award ceremony in recognition of their contribution to promoting disaster preparedness across public and private sectors.

Mr Wong emphasised that voting is a civic responsibility for every voter. He called on the public to cherish and cast their votes in the Legislative Council General Election on December 7, electing competent representatives to help turn Hong Kong into an even better home for everyone.

Throughout the promotional months, the FSD will collaborate with various District Offices, District Fire Safety Committees, and community partners to host a range of disaster and emergency preparedness events including carnivals, fire station open days and publicity events at shopping malls. The FSD's mobile publicity vehicle will also tour the city to disseminate disaster and emergency preparedness messages to the public. Latest information of the activities will be available at the FSD's social media platforms and the Hong Kong Fire Services Department Mobile Application.

The Winter Disaster and Emergency Preparedness Promotional Months is one of the key initiatives under the Fire Services Department's Disaster Management Programme funded by the Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust, with an aim to enhance the community's resilience to disasters.The FSDCER Scheme is also funded by the Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust.

title: CS reaches out to community to promote 2025 Legislative Council General Election (with photos/video)
news_content:
The Chief Secretary for Administration, Mr Chan Kwok-ki, together with the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs, Mr Erick Tsang Kwok-wai, and the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs, Miss Alice Mak, today (November 1) joined a community outreach to promote the 2025 Legislative Council (LegCo) General Election. At a promotional booth outside Kwai Fong MTR station, they encouraged members of the public to cast their votes on the polling day on December 7. The Under Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs, Mr Clement Woo, and the Under Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs, Mr Clarence Leung, were also present to join the promotion.

  Mr Chan said the nomination period for the LegCo General Election has started. Outstanding individuals with an affection for the country and Hong Kong, proven capabilities, a sense of responsibility and a passion to serve the public should submit nominations before the close of the nomination period on November 6. He also said that each vote in the upcoming LegCo election is very important. He called on all electors to fulfil their civic responsibility by actively casting their votes to elect legislators who represent people's voices and are committed to the good governance, progress and prosperity of Hong Kong, where people can live and work in contentment.

  Mr Chan, Mr Tsang and Miss Mak spoke to members of the public and distributed to them promotional leaflets and souvenirs of the Ballot Box Family mascots. They also took the opportunity to call on the public to reserve time for voting on the polling day on December 7.

  This promotional booth event was organised by the Home and Youth Affairs Bureau in collaboration with a youth organisation to promote the 2025 LegCo General Election. The Government will continue to set up more promotional booths in various districts to publicise electoral messages. Principal Officials will also participate in the initiative with a view to boosting the electoral atmosphere in society and raising public awareness of the election.

title: CE attends APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting Retreat in Korea (with photos/video)
news_content:
âThe Chief Executive, Mr John Lee, attended the 32nd Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Economic Leaders' Meeting Retreat in Gyeongju, Korea, today (November 1) to exchange views with leaders of other economies on issues including AI development and demographic changes.

Speaking at the meeting in the morning, Mr Lee pointed out that the Asia-Pacific region is undergoing profound changes, from digital and green transitions to sweeping demographic changes, and that it is essential to grasp the opportunities wrought by these transformative shifts in order to build a future-ready Asia-Pacific.

Mr Lee proposed that APEC member economies must remain steadfast in their commitment to multilateralism, grounded on the principles of inclusivity, equality, and cooperation; leverage the innovative power of AI as a key driver of economic growth; and make good use of APEC as a platform for expanding cooperation, unlocking new and inclusive drivers of growth.

The APEC member economies jointly adopted and issued the 2025 APEC Leaders' Gyeongju Declaration, which addresses the shared opportunities and challenges facing the Asia-Pacific region and expresses support for APEC as an important platform for regional economic cooperation, the strengthening of connectivity in the Asia-Pacific region, and the building of resilient supply chains. Mr Lee looks forward to pursuing practical cooperation with fellow member economies in these areas, working together to advance high-quality economic development in the Asia-Pacific region.

Mr Lee concluded his visit to Korea and will return to Hong Kong tomorrow (November 2).

title: 行政長官在韓國出席亞太區經濟合作組織領導人非正式會議（附圖／短片）
news_content:
​行政長官李家超今日（十一月一日）在韓國慶州出席亞太區經濟合作組織（亞太經合組織）第三十二次領導人非正式會議，與其他經濟體領導人就人工智能發展和人口變化等議題交流意見。

李家超早上在會議發言時指出，亞太區正面對數字化、綠色轉型，以及全面的人口結構變化等深刻轉變，必須把握這些變革所帶來的機遇，為未來做好準備。

李家超提出，亞太經合組織成員經濟體要秉持包容、平等與合作的原則，堅持多邊主義；發揮人工智能的創新力量，將人工智能作為經濟增長的關鍵驅動力；用好亞太經合組織這個平台拓展合作，釋放嶄新而且包容的增長力量。

亞太經合組織成員經濟體共同通過和發表《2025年亞太經合組織領導人慶州宣言》，涵蓋亞太區共同面對的機遇與挑戰，支持亞太經合組織作為區域經濟合作的重要平台、加強亞太區的互聯互通，以及構建具韌性的供應鏈。李家超期待在這些領域與各成員經濟體開展務實合作，共同推動亞太區高質量經濟發展。

李家超結束韓國的訪問行程，將於明日（十一月二日）返港。

title: 香港海關檢獲約一千六百萬元懷疑氯胺酮（附圖）
news_content:
​香港海關與內地海關緝私部門進行聯合執法行動，根據情報分析，香港海關於十月二十七日搜查一個位於西環的迷你儲存倉，並於一件包裹發現四個膠桶內藏約十公斤懷疑氯胺酮。

其後，香港海關十月二十八日截查一件由德國經內地寄到香港，報稱儀器零件的包裹，在九個膠袋內發現共約二十五公斤懷疑氯胺酮。

香港海關透過深入調查，鎖定一名男子，懷疑他管控上述兩件毒品包裹，並於昨日（十月三十一日）在上環把他拘捕。

被捕男子四十九歲，報稱物流銷售員。案件仍在調查中。

根據《危險藥物條例》，販運危險藥物屬嚴重罪行，一經定罪，最高可被判罰款五百萬元及終身監禁。

市民可致電海關二十四小時熱線182 8080，或透過舉報罪案專用電郵帳戶（crimereport@customs.gov.hk）或網上表格（eform.cefs.gov.hk/form/ced002）舉報懷疑販毒活動。

title: Hong Kong Customs seizes suspected ketamine worth about $16 million (with photo)
news_content:
âHong Kong Customs and anti-smuggling departments of the Mainland Customs conducted a joint operation. Through intelligence analysis, Hong Kong Customs on October 27 searched a mini-storage warehouse in Sai Wan and found about 10 kilograms of suspected ketamine concealed inside four plastic buckets in a parcel.

Subsequently, on October 28, Hong Kong Customs intercepted a parcel from Germany declared as instrument parts sent to Hong Kong via the Mainland, and discovered a total of about 25kg of suspected ketamine in nine plastic bags.

Through an in-depth investigation, Hong Kong Customs targeted a man who was suspected of controlling the two drug parcels and arrested him in Sheung Wan yesterday (October 31).

The arrested man, aged 49, claimed to be a logistic sales. An investigation is ongoing.

Under the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance, trafficking in a dangerous drug is a serious offence. The maximum penalty upon conviction is a fine of $5 million and life imprisonment.

Members of the public may report any suspected drug trafficking activities to Customs' 24-hour hotline 182 8080 or its dedicated crime-reporting email account (crimereport@customs.gov.hk) or online form (eform.cefs.gov.hk/form/ced002).

title: 政務司司長落區宣傳二○二五年立法會換屆選舉（附圖／短片）
news_content:
政務司司長陳國基今日（十一月一日）聯同政制及內地事務局局長曾國衞和民政及青年事務局局長麥美娟落區宣傳二○二五年立法會換屆選舉，在葵芳港鐵站外的宣傳街站，呼籲市民於十二月七日投票日踴躍投票。政制及內地事務局副局長胡健民與民政及青年事務局副局長梁宏正亦陪同出席，參與宣傳。

陳國基表示，立法會換屆選舉的提名期已經展開。愛國愛港、有能力、有擔當、熱心服務市民的人士應於十一月六日提名期結束前積極參選。他又說，即將舉行的立法會選舉，每一票都很重要，呼籲全港選民履行公民責任，踴躍投票，選出代表市民聲音的立法會議員，為香港的良政善治、繁榮進步，以至大家的安居樂業共同努力，共創更美好明天。

陳國基、曾國衞和麥美娟向市民派發宣傳單張和吉祥物票箱家族紀念品，並與在場市民交談，趁機呼籲他們於十二月七日投票日當天預留時間投票。

是次街站活動由民政及青年事務局及青年組織合辦，為政府宣傳立法會換屆選舉設置。政府會陸續於各區設置更多街站宣傳選舉信息，主要官員亦會參與推廣，以提升社會的選舉氣氛和大眾對選舉的關注。

title: 政務司司長出席國泰飛躍理想計劃──空中之旅2025致辭（只有中文）（附圖／短片）
news_content:
以下是政務司司長陳國基今日（十一月一日）出席國泰飛躍理想計劃──空中之旅2025的致辭：

劉凱詩總裁（國泰顧客及商務總裁）、各位嘉賓、各位國泰航空的同事、各位「共創明『Teen』計劃」的學員、各位循道衛理觀塘社會服務處的同學、各位朋友、各位傳媒朋友：

大家好！今日很開心再次來到香港國際機場，與各位一起參加國泰飛躍理想計劃──空中之旅。像剛才總裁所說，我已來了三次，不過我也希望未來有機會可以再來很多次。

首先，我很衷心感謝國泰一直鼎力支持「共創明『Teen』計劃」，為三期計劃合共推薦了超過50名友師，並且精心安排了40多項活動，一共為超過3 600名學員和友師提供航空體驗之旅。除了今天的「空中之旅」外，還有參觀國泰城和不同機場設施的活動，涵蓋國泰餐飲及國泰貨運等不同範疇。這些活動不單只是航空體驗，我相信也是使我們學員更了解一架飛機飛上天空，不只是那麼簡單，背後有很多不同的人、不同的專家一起努力的成果，大家有機會去參觀這些便會知道，單單是總裁剛才所說的簡單餐飲其實也是一個大型的運作。要做到最好，需要很多方面的配合才可以。

各位國泰的友師，很感謝你們對學員的陪伴、指導和分享，這些不但提升學員的自信心，更幫助他們以積極態度規劃未來，為職業生涯打好基礎。你們無私和真誠的付出，正正是「共創明『Teen』計劃」最寶貴的資源。真的很感謝你們！因為我剛開始時經常都很擔心香港不夠友師，原來我是不用擔心的。友師有時候比學員更多。對此我真的很感謝。

香港之所以會成功，我經常認為是因為有很多有心的人，願意出心出力，各位學員真的要好好珍惜這個很好的機會，當自己是「海綿」就可以了，吸收友師給你們的知識，這個非常重要。

今天的「空中之旅」是「國泰飛躍理想計劃」最受期待的年度壓軸盛事，剛才我進來的時候就看見180名青年人面帶笑容，很開心的。其實大家都感受到你們的興奮和期待，相信大家已經急不及待，想盡快開展這次旅程。

我知道好像剛才總裁所說，今天大部分的年青人都是第一次坐飛機的。這絕對會是一趟難忘的經驗！我也鼓勵大家把握機會開拓視野、增長知識、認識多點朋友。但我認為難忘的體驗，還有另一個原因，就是大家將來因為種種原因經常都要坐飛機，但今次這麼特別的航班是從香港飛香港的，我相信你們以後很難有機會再坐了，好好珍惜這一次那麼特別的旅程，很感謝國泰。

展望未來，政府會持續結合社會各界力量，透過政、商、民三方的合作，進一步強化「共創明『Teen』計劃」。我們也得到香港賽馬會的一千萬元慷慨支持，我們會進一步豐富「共創明『Teen』校友會」的活動內容，延續計劃的成效，培育他們成為未來社會的棟樑。

要建設更好的香港，需要我們的積極參與，我也要在此「賣廣告」：十二月七日是立法會選舉投票日，我呼籲在場所有嘉賓，如果你是有資格投票的，當天踴躍投票，選出為香港發展貢獻力量的立法會議員。而各位「共創明『Teen』」的學員，雖然你們應該還未達到投票年齡，但我希望大家從現在開始，多關心社會事務，在將來符合資格時，立即登記成為選民，貢獻自己的一分力量。

各位學員，今日的「空中之旅」，不只是一場活動，更是一次夢想啓航的旅程。我預祝各位享受接下來90分鐘的飛行體驗，希望你們滿載而歸！我也衷心祝願國泰業務蒸蒸日上，繼續與社會攜手並肩，進一步提升香港作為國際航空樞紐的地位。謝謝大家！

我知道好像剛才總裁所說，今天大部分的年青人都是第一次坐飛機的。這絕對會是一趟難忘的經驗！我也鼓勵大家把握機會開拓視野、增長知識、認識多點朋友。但我認為難忘的體驗，還有另一個原因，就是大家將來因為種種原因經常都要坐飛機，但今次這麼特別的航班是從香港飛香港的，我相信你們以後很難有機會再坐了，好好珍惜這一次那麼特別的旅程，很感謝國泰。

展望未來，政府會持續結合社會各界力量，透過政、商、民三方的合作，進一步強化「共創明『Teen』計劃」。我們也得到香港賽馬會的一千萬元慷慨支持，我們會進一步豐富「共創明『Teen』校友會」的活動內容，延續計劃的成效，培育他們成為未來社會的棟樑。

要建設更好的香港，需要我們的積極參與，我也要在此「賣廣告」：十二月七日是立法會選舉投票日，我呼籲在場所有嘉賓，如果你是有資格投票的，當天踴躍投票，選出為香港發展貢獻力量的立法會議員。而各位「共創明『Teen』」的學員，雖然你們應該還未達到投票年齡，但我希望大家從現在開始，多關心社會事務，在將來符合資格時，立即登記成為選民，貢獻自己的一分力量。

各位學員，今日的「空中之旅」，不只是一場活動，更是一次夢想啓航的旅程。我預祝各位享受接下來90分鐘的飛行體驗，希望你們滿載而歸！我也衷心祝願國泰業務蒸蒸日上，繼續與社會攜手並肩，進一步提升香港作為國際航空樞紐的地位。謝謝大家！
